intro: Heliophytum kotschyi, commonly known as the desert star or rock rose, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Heliophytum kotschyi thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suited to dry climates. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
